title: How to Copy Favorites & Export Bookmarks to a Flash Drive

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's the red, yellow, green, and blue sphere icon.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . You'll find this three-dot menu icon in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select Bookmarks.
steps.content: Select Bookmarks . It's about halfway down the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Bookmark manager.
steps.content: Click Bookmark manager . This option is near the top of the pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This three-dot menu icon is in the far-right side of the bar that's at the top of the page. [3] X Research source Make sure you don't click the ⋮ icon that you clicked to open the drop-down menu earlier.

steps.title: Click Export bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Export bookmarks . This is towards the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. Type in a name for your bookmarks file or keep the default name that's usually "Bookmarks" and the current date.

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. You should see your flash drive in the panel on the left side of the window. Once you click the flash drive, you will be able to navigate within it to find a location to save your file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window and your bookmarks will save to your flash drive. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. Click or double-click the blue, compass-shaped icon in your Mac's Dock.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This menu item is in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export Bookmarks….
steps.content: Click Export Bookmarks… . You'll find this option near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. In the "Save As" field, type in a name for your bookmarks file.

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. Click the "Where" drop-down box, then click your flash drive to select it as the location to save your bookmarks.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's a button at the bottom of the window and will save your bookmark file to your flash drive. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Click the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue globe.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the top-right side of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Library.
steps.content: Click Library . You'll find it near the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Click Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Bookmarks . It's near the top of the menu. A new drop-down menu will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Show All Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Show All Bookmarks . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Bookmarks window.

steps.title: Click Import and Backup.
steps.content: Click Import and Backup . This option is the star-and-arrows icon at the top of the bookmarks library window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML….
steps.content: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML… . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. A window will open. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. Type in the name that you want to use for your bookmarks file.

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. You should see it listed in the panel on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so will prompt your bookmarks file to download onto your flash drive. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. Click or double-click the Microsoft Edge app icon, which resembles a dark-blue "e". In some cases, the Edge icon will be a white "e" on a dark-blue background.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . This three-dot menu icon is in the top-right corner of the window. A pop-out menu will appear. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Click Import from another browser.
steps.content: Click Import from another browser . It's below the "Import favorites and other info" heading in the pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click Export to file.
steps.content: Click Export to file . You'll find this button near the bottom of the menu. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. Type a name for your bookmarks file into the "File name" field.

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. You should see it listed in the menu on the left side of the window. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will save your file and download it onto your flash drive. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Open Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Open Internet Explorer. It's the light-blue "e" icon with a yellow band wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click the "Favorites" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Favorites" icon. This star-shaped icon is in the top-right side of the window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This downwards pointing arrow is to the right of the "Add to favorites" box. Doing so prompts a menu.

steps.title: Click Import and export….
steps.content: Click Import and export… . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Check the "Export to a file" option.
steps.content: Check the "Export to a file" option. It's the bottom option in the pop-up window.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . This is on the lower-right side of the pop-up window. [16] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Check the "Favorites" box, then click Next.
steps.content: Check the "Favorites" box, then click Next . The "Favorites" box is at the top of the window.

steps.title: Select the "Favorites" folder, then click Next.
steps.content: Select the "Favorites" folder, then click Next . Simply click the "Favorites" folder icon once to ensure that it is selected as the folder to export.

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. Click Browse , then click your flash drive from the panel on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. Type in the name that you want to use for your bookmarks folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export . This option is at the bottom of the pop-up window.

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will close the Export window. Your bookmarks file should now be on your computer. [17] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
